definitions.definition: A secular ecclesiastic, or one not bound by monastic rules.
A church official whose functions are confined to the vocal department of the choir.
A layman, as distinguished from a clergyman.
Not specifically religious; lay or civil, as opposed to clerical.
Temporal; worldly, or otherwise not based on something timeless.
Not bound by the vows of a monastic order.
Happening once in an age or century.
definitions.example: The secular games of ancient Rome were held to mark the end of a saeculum and the beginning of the next.

definitions.definition: Continuing over a long period of time, long-term.
definitions.example: The long-term growth in population and income accounts for most secular trends in economic phenomena.

definitions.definition: Relating to long-term non-periodic irregularities, especially in planetary motion or magnetic field.
